interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Sea Salt Soap, Sea Mineral Soap, Invigorating Bath Soap, Cleaner Removal Pimple Pores Acne Goat Milk Moisturizing Face Care Soap, for All Skin type
Review Date: 2019/11/10
Store: AMINZER
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Item Form': 'Bar', 'Skin Type': 'Sensitive', 'Brand': 'AMINZER', 'Scent': 'Coconut', 'Material Feature': 'Natural, Cruelty Free, Paraben Free', 'Package Dimensions': '3.43 x 3.27 x 1.42 inches; 4.27 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1107-149'}
Review Text: Great for your pores and acne. My husband's back started breaking out and after using this for a few days it's clearing up and looks less irritated. Plus it came with a bag which I didn't know what for until I read the instructions and it is a foaming bag and it really makes the soap foam!
Review Title: Good for your pores 🧼🧼🧼
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Liquid Foundation Cream, Concealer Cover Cream, BB Cream, Flawless Colour Changing Foundation Makeup Base Nude Face Liquid Cover Concealer, Universal for ALL Skin Types, SPF 15 Shell, 1.41 Fl Oz
BUOCEANS Official
{'Item Form': 'Liquid', 'Skin Type': 'All', 'Finish Type': 'Sheer', 'Recommended Uses For Product': 'Pores, Dryness', 'Package Information': 'Bottle', 'Package Dimensions': '4.9 x 1.8 x 1.8 inches; 3.21 Ounces'}
I am so glad they made a product like this because I can never seem to find the right color to match my skin and I end up with that Foundation the line on my chin with the two different colors. Not only is this product lightweight, it smells nice, plus it blends in with my skin tone almost perfectly. This is definitely going to be my go to Foundation.
Awesome foundation!
Hair Mask,Natural Repair Rejuvenating Hair Mask,Moisturizing Nourishing Hair for Dry and Damaged Hair,Professional Heating Deep Conditioning Hair Treatment
LDREAMAM
{'Brand': 'LDREAMAM', 'Material Feature': 'Natural', 'Hair Type': 'Dry', 'Unit Count': '2 Count', 'Package Type': 'Jar', 'Package Dimensions': '7.52 x 5.08 x 0.79 inches; 4.23 Ounces'}
Made my hair soft again! Not the easiest thing to get on when you have long hair but I managed. Then after the time required I wash my hair and couldn't believe how soft it was. It hasn't been that soft in a long time. So I definitely think it was worth the trouble stuffing all my hair in there and letting it sit plus it doesn't smell the greatest, nor does it smell bad I'm just used to very perfumed shampoos. But I'll definitely be using it again.
Softness again!

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Cosmetics Preferences:** This user maintains a strong preference for lightweight liquid foundations and concealers that offer good coverage and blend seamlessly. 
- **Skin Type Consideration:** They appreciate versatile products suitable for all skin types, reflecting an emphasis on inclusivity in their selections.
- **Color Matching:** The user values effective color matching, having experienced prior dissatisfaction with mismatched foundation shades.
- **Fragrance and Texture:** They prefer pleasant scents in makeup with a sheer finish, prioritizing comfort and sensory experience. Recently, they have shown a willingness to explore products with more neutral fragrances, as indicated by their hair care choices.
- **Functionality:** They are particularly interested in products that address common concerns such as pores, dryness, and moisture, as demonstrated by their recent positive interactions with skincare and hair care products that promote these benefits.
- **General Sentiment:** The user seeks effective, easy-to-use cosmetics and skincare solutions that enhance their appearance without feeling heavy. Their review of a cleansing soap for acne and pore issues reflects their practical approach to maintaining skin health and their openness to trying new products that deliver results.

Overall, this user is enthusiastic about high-performance products that balance effectiveness with a pleasant use experience, aligning with their natural-looking beauty ideal.
